items.description: No abstract

items.title: Development and Preliminary Validation of a Rapid On-Site Detection Method for Schmallenberg Virus Using RT-RAA-LFD
items.description: Schmallenberg virus (SBV) is an emerging arbovirus that causes fever, diarrhea, abortion, and congenital malformations in ruminants. The disease spreads rapidly and poses significant control challenges. Upon its identification, SBV disseminated across Europe, causing major economic losses in livestock production and international trade. Although vaccines exist in certain regions, effective treatment options remain limited, highlighting the need for rapid, early, and accurate detection. In this...

items.title: 3D Analysis of Age-Related Compensation of Retinal Capillary Plexuses in Normal Population via Wide-Field Volume-Mode SS-OCTA: Focus on Interlayer Connecting Branches
items.description: CONCLUSION: Normal RCP has an age-related compensatory mechanism: "sacrificing peripheral blood flow to protect macular blood flow". This compensation is supported by interlayer branch changes: vertical branches decrease while oblique branches become relatively dominant. It maintains macular blood flow and central vision, helping distinguish normal aging from pathological vascular damage.
items.conclusion: Normal RCP has an age-related compensatory mechanism: "sacrificing peripheral blood flow to protect macular blood flow". This compensation is supported by interlayer branch changes: vertical branches decrease while oblique branches become relatively dominant

items.title: Solution viscosity and ion-specific crosslinking govern structure of alginate and pectin hydrogels: Correlating solid-state NMR with rheology
items.description: Hydrogels are widely utilized in biomedical, food, and pharmaceutical applications, where their functionality depends critically on their tunable mechanical and dynamic properties. These properties are governed by the solution viscosity and the nature of ionic crosslinking within their constituent polymers. This study elucidates the molecular and rheological relationships among polymer viscosity, molar mass, crosslinking ion identity, and their collective influence on structure-property behavior...

items.title: Isolation and trypsin-trigged release of circulating tumor cells from core/shell nylon-6/methacrylated gelatin immunofiber mats for reculture through microfluidic chips
items.description: A novel approach has been developed to efficiently isolate and reculture model circulating tumor cells (mCTCs) using a fiber-based microfluidic platform. This system features a core-shell structure composed of a polycaprolactam (Ny) core and a outer layer of cross-linked methacrylated gelatin (GelMA) infused with a photoinitiator (PI). The Ny/GelMA composite immunofiber mats are fabricated via coaxial electrospinning, where a PI concentration of 1.5 wt% enhances the viscosity of the GelMA,...

items.title: Lignin-stabilized silver nanoparticles for fruit packaging: Synergistic antibacterial activity and tailored gas permeability
items.description: Fruit packaging is critical for maintaining safety and freshness, yet conventional petroleum-based materials lack controlled gas permeability and antibacterial functionality, severely limiting shelf-life extension. Current strategies use electrospun nanofibers loaded with silver nanoparticles (Ag NPs) to confer breathability and antibacterial activity; however, the agglomeration and instability of Ag NPs impede practical applications. Herein, we use sodium lignosulfonate (SL) to reduce and...

items.title: Effect of mechanical relaxation of 3D-printed collagen-based extracellular matrix on behavior of neural cell
items.description: This review explores how mechanical relaxation in 3D-printed collagen-based extracellular matrices (CECMs) impacts the behavior of neural cells. 3D printing technology has significantly revolutionized tissue engineering, enabling the creation of CECMs with accurate control over their mechanical properties. Current studies show that the mechanical relaxation of these 3D-printed CECMs can significantly influence the behavior of embedded neural cells. This review synthesizes current knowledge on...

items.title: CvTFuse: An unsupervised medical image fusion method of gliomas T1-DWI mode
items.description: CONCLUSION: This method can combine information from different modalities of MR images, allowing for accurate localization of lesion areas. It also utilizes rich clinical information to aid in the precise diagnosis and formulation of treatment plans.
items.conclusion: This method can combine information from different modalities of MR images, allowing for accurate localization of lesion areas. It also utilizes rich clinical information to aid in the precise diagnosis and formulation of treatment plans

items.title: Rora Regulates Hematopoietic Stem Cell Phenotypes and Progression of Chronic Myelogenous Leukemia
items.description: Hematopoietic stem cell (HSC) aging leads to hematological dysfunction and diseases, but the regulatory factors involved remain incompletely characterized. In this study, HasCATs model was developed to identify transcription factors (TFs) that resist HSC aging. This approach revealed RORA as a key Aging-Negative-Associated TF. Rora deletion in HSCs caused aged phenomes and functionally impaired their reconstitutive capacity. Additionally, Rora deficiency impaired leukemia stem cells (LSC)...

items.title: Colitogenic Environment Suppresses Notch/mTOR-Mediated Epithelial Proliferation to Promote Goblet Cell Differentiation in the Colon
items.description: Epithelial barrier dysfunction is a hallmark of inflammatory bowel diseases (IBD); however, the mechanisms underlying such impairment remain incompletely understood. In the present study, a DSS-induced colitis model was used to investigate how the inflammatory environment damages the intestinal mucosa. The results demonstrated that colitogenic ambiance enhances intestinal epithelial cell death, delays epithelial cell proliferation, and exacerbates mucosal erosion. Unexpectedly, this work...

items.title: Your Brain on Nature: A Scoping Review of the Neuroscience of Nature Exposure
items.description: The relationship between natural environments and human cognition has gathered increasing attention across disciplines, including neuroscience, environmental psychology, and public health. An expanding body of empirical evidence supports the notion that exposure to nature consistently promotes psychological and physiological well-being. However, our understanding of the neural mechanisms underlying these benefits remains limited. This scoping review synthesizes experimental findings from...

items.title: Optimizing DIBH Patient Selection in Left Breast Cancer Radiotherapy: A Rapid Screening Strategy
items.description: CONCLUSIONS: We propose a rapid screening strategy for assessing DIBH suitability for patients treated with left-sided breast radiotherapy. This strategy has the potential to greatly optimize clinical workflow and reduce the burden on both patients and healthcare providers.
items.conclusion: We propose a rapid screening strategy for assessing DIBH suitability for patients treated with left-sided breast radiotherapy. This strategy has the potential to greatly optimize clinical workflow and reduce the burden on both patients and healthcare providers

items.title: Family History of Kidney Failure, APOL-1 Risk Variants, Social Determinants of Health, and Risk of CKD Progression: Findings From the CRIC Study
items.description: CONCLUSION: Among people with CKD, Black race was significantly associated with a family history of kidney failure, even in those without the high risk APOL1 allele status. After adjusting for SDoH and APOL1 status, the family history of kidney failure remained associated with the risk of CKD progression. These findings highlight the importance of collecting information on family history and the need for further efforts to understand the reasons for familial aggregation of CKD.
items.conclusion: Among people with CKD, Black race was significantly associated with a family history of kidney failure, even in those without the high risk APOL1 allele status. After adjusting for SDoH and APOL1 status, the family history of kidney failure remained associated with the risk of CKD progression

items.title: Efficacy and Safety of Activated Charcoal in Primary Gout: A Double-Blind, Double-Dummy, Randomized Controlled Trial
items.description: CONCLUSIONS: The febuxostat-AC combination regimen didn't enhance urate-lowering effects but significantly reduced gout flare frequency, delayed the onset of first flare, and improved LDL-C levels. These findings underscore the role of AC in comprehensive gout management.
items.conclusion: The febuxostat-AC combination regimen didn't enhance urate-lowering effects but significantly reduced gout flare frequency, delayed the onset of first flare, and improved LDL-C levels. These findings underscore the role of AC in comprehensive gout management

items.title: Skeletal Interfaces in Health and Disease - Where two worlds interact: The Salzburg Leopoldina Symposium 2025 - Bridging Disciplines and Perspectives
items.description: CONCLUSIONS: By creating a platform for cross-disciplinary exchange, the symposium illustrated how musculoskeletal research benefits from conceptual bridges between different scientific fields. Such interfaces may not only inspire novel research questions, but also hold potential to redefine clinical applications and public health strategies. This perspective article reflects the transdisciplinary spirit of the symposium, aiming to capture and communicate the enthusiasm, scientific breadth, and...
items.conclusion: By creating a platform for cross-disciplinary exchange, the symposium illustrated how musculoskeletal research benefits from conceptual bridges between different scientific fields. Such interfaces may not only inspire novel research questions, but also hold potential to redefine clinical application...

items.title: Confounders, diagnostic accuracy and reproducibility in CMR-feature tracking derived left atrial strain: A BER-CMR multi-software, multi-site comparison
items.description: CONCLUSION: Post-processing software is a significant confounder in CMR-FT based LA-GLS analysis and age substantially influences LA-GLS. LA-GLS demonstrates excellent inter-site reproducibility when analyzed with the same software and offers comparable diagnostic accuracy across platforms.
items.conclusion: Post-processing software is a significant confounder in CMR-FT based LA-GLS analysis and age substantially influences LA-GLS. LA-GLS demonstrates excellent inter-site reproducibility when analyzed with the same software and offers comparable diagnostic accuracy across platforms

items.title: Cell Membrane-Coated Nanoparticles Target Multiorgan Crosstalk in Cardiovascular-Kidney-Metabolic Syndrome
items.description: Cardiovascular-Kidney-Metabolic (CKM) syndrome is a complex, integrated disorder marked by metabolic dysregulation that drives interorgan crosstalk through inflammatory, oxidative, and fibrotic pathways, ultimately leading to multiorgan dysfunction. Although organ-specific therapies confer cardioprotective and renoprotective benefits, current management remains fragmented and does not adequately address the interconnected biology of CKM syndrome. Cell membrane-coated nanoparticles (CMNPs) are a...

items.title: Telemedicine-based diabetic retinopathy screening in patients over 70 Years: a French cohort study within the OPHDIAT network
items.description: CONCLUSION: . - Teleophthalmology-based DR screening appeared feasible and clinically relevant in patients aged ≥70 years, allowing identifying patients requiring ophthalmologic evaluation, while also detecting other age-related ocular diseases. Pupil dilation is recommended to optimize image quality in this population.
items.conclusion: . - Teleophthalmology-based DR screening appeared feasible and clinically relevant in patients aged ≥70 years, allowing identifying patients requiring ophthalmologic evaluation, while also detecting other age-related ocular diseases

items.title: Age-Specific Disparities in Temperature-Related Injury Risks and Burdens among Chinese Children
items.description: Injury is a major cause of morbidity and mortality among children, yet evidence on the influence of ambient temperature on childhood injury remains limited. This study quantified the association between temperature and child injury across age groups in China from 2006 to 2021 and projected the future burden attributable to temperature under climate change scenarios. Injury data were derived from the National Injury Surveillance System, and meteorological data were obtained from the fifth...

items.title: Evaluation of recombinant Toxoplasma gondii matrix antigen MAG1 for toxoplasmosis screening in HIV/AIDS patients
items.description: Timely serodiagnosis of Toxoplasma gondii is critical for HIV/AIDS patients, in whom latent infection can reactivate into life-threatening toxoplasmic encephalitis. This study aimed to evaluate the diagnostic performance of a novel recombinant T. gondii matrix antigen 1 (TgMAG1)-based indirect ELISA and a commercial latex agglutination test (LAT) for detecting anti-T. gondii IgG in HIV/AIDS patients, using the Sabin-Feldman dye test (DT) as the reference standard. A secondary objective was to...

items.title: Donor search and selection strategy to facilitate comparable transplant rates across donor search prognosis groups: A report from the BMT CTN 1702 trial
items.description: CONCLUSION: In this prospective, multicenter evaluation of donor search and selection practices, we demonstrate that patients with poor likelihood of 8/8 MUD matching can reach HCT at comparable rates and with similar effort (time spent typing, number of donors typed) using an early Alt-D-centered strategy. Uniformly across SP, target time to HCT is not commonly reached and is disrupted mostly by disease/patient health delays, not commonly donor availability.
items.conclusion: In this prospective, multicenter evaluation of donor search and selection practices, we demonstrate that patients with poor likelihood of 8/8 MUD matching can reach HCT at comparable rates and with similar effort (time spent typing, number of donors typed) using an early Alt-D-centered strategy. Uni...

items.title: Tracking the Impact of PFAS Regulations: Long-Term Analysis of Roe Deer Livers From 1998 Until 2022
items.description: PER: and polyfluoroalkyl substances (PFAS) are persistent environmental pollutants with widespread occurrence and bioaccumulation potential. Regulatory measures have been introduced to limit the use of certain PFAS, yet their presence remains detectable in wildlife. This study examines long-term trends in PFAS concentrations in one-year-old roe deer livers (n=28) collected from the Bavarian Forest National Park between 1998 and 2022. Targeted analysis revealed that ΣPFAS(target) significantly...

items.title: PM2.5-modulated targets and miRNAs associated with lung cancer and injury are protected by natural products
items.description: Particulate matter 2.5 (PM2.5) is a ubiquitous air pollutant in both outdoor and indoor environments globally. Attenuating PM2.5 toxicity with natural products has benefits for health. Most PM2.5-modulated targets and miRNAs have been reported in a simplified manner without interconnections to their counteractive natural products. In this review, the target-target interaction in PM2.5 studies is explored using the bioinformatic STRING database. miRNAs and natural products that regulate these...
